jobs.title: Senior Security Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Haus

Haus is the incrementality platform leading brands trust to optimize billions in ad spend worldwide. Using frontier causal inference-based econometric models to run experiments, we help brands measure the business impact of marketing, pricing, and promotions with scientific precision. Over $360B is spent annually on paid advertising in the US alone, and the famous quote “half the money I spend on advertising is wasted; the trouble is I don't know which half” still rings true. Haus helps marketers identify which half, and reallocate it to maximize growth.

With a founding team of former product managers, economists, and engineers from Google, Netflix, Meta, and Amazon, we make high-quality decision science,incrementality testing, and causal marketing mix modeling accessible to businesses of all sizes—automating the heavy lifting of experiment design, data processing, and insights generation. Haus works with leading brands like FanDuel, Sonos, and Dr. Squatch, delivering ROI gains as high as 30x.

Haus is well-capitalized and backed by top-tier VCs, including Insight Partners, Baseline Ventures, Haystack, and others. We're honored that Haus has once again been recognized by LinkedIn as a 2025 Top Startup!


What you’ll do

At Haus, security isn’t a checkbox — it’s built into the way we design, move, and use data. As a Senior Security Engineer, you’ll play a central role in building the infrastructure, data frameworks, and access models that keep our platform safe and compliant while enabling our teams to move fast.

This is a role for an engineer who thrives on autonomy, takes ownership, and has the drive to turn complex security challenges into elegant, scalable solutions. You’ll be hands-on with cloud infrastructure, identity and access management, and data security — while also serving as a trusted consultant to product engineering squads, helping shape secure patterns and best practices across the organization.

Responsibilities

  • Design and implement least-privilege IAM models across our Google Cloud Platform environments using Terraform.

  • Engineer systems that control and monitor data boundaries and movement (ETL pipelines, data lakes, transformations).

  • Build mechanisms for dataset tagging, access workflows, and live filtering to enforce compliance controls programmatically.

  • Partner with compliance to translate frameworks (SOC 2, ISO 27001, etc.) into practical engineering solutions.

  • Evaluate and reduce the blast radius of permissions across infrastructure, applications, and AI-powered services.

  • Contribute to the design of new systems, ensuring security is embedded at the architecture stage.

  • Act as a security consultant to product engineering squads, providing guidance on secure design patterns and reviewing new services for risk.

  • Stay ahead of emerging AI and data security risks, and propose pragmatic defenses.

What you bring

  • 7+ years of experience in security engineering, platform engineering, or related fields.

  • Strong background in cloud security (GCP strongly preferred; AWS or Azure with strong GCP understanding also valued).

  • Deep knowledge of identity and access management (IAM) principles and implementations.

  • Experience with Terraform or other infrastructure-as-code tools.

  • Familiarity with data frameworks, pipelines, and transformation workflows (ETL, data lakes, metadata tagging).

  • Ability to analyze and communicate security risks clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

  • Familiarity with AI/ML data movement and associated risks is a plus.

What we value

  • Autonomy and initiative — you’re a self-starter who can drive projects forward with minimal oversight.

  • Influence through partnership — you know how to embed security practices into product squads without slowing them down.

  • Pragmatism over dogma — balancing speed, security, and business needs.

  • Curiosity and adaptability in a fast-moving environment.

Clarity in communication — explaining technical security concepts without jargon.


What we offer

We’re a high-performance, low-ego team operating in a fast-moving environment. We care deeply about our customers and expect everyone to take full ownership of their work — this is a place where high expectations fuel even higher growth.

If you thrive in ambiguity, take pride in raising the bar, and want to work alongside top-tier peers who challenge and support you, you'll find unmatched opportunities here. If you're looking for predictability or rigid structure or you prefer order-taking to go-getting, we’re probably not the right fit — and that’s okay.

We work in small, mission-driven teams that prioritize inclusion, collaboration, and growth over hierarchy or red tape.

Some of our benefits include:

  • Flexible PTO - take time when you need it!

  • Equity – Startup environment with part-ownership in our successes

  • Top of the line health, dental, and vision insurance - multiple plan options so you can pick what fits you best

  • WFH stipend to support the set up you need to be productive

  • Events & Offsites – opportunities to connect and celebrate in real life!

  • Free Lunch – Grab a bite on us when you choose to work from the office (hub locations include SF, NYC and Seattle)

  • New Parent Leave – take time to welcome your newest Hausmate

Haus is an equal opportunity employer. We make hiring decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other protected status.

We believe diverse perspectives make us stronger and are committed to an inclusive culture where everyone feels seen, heard, and empowered to contribute. Bring your authentic self — we would love to hear from you.

jobs.title: Solutions Consultant
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Haus

Haus is the incrementality platform leading brands trust to optimize billions in ad spend worldwide. Using frontier causal inference-based econometric models to run experiments, we help brands measure the business impact of marketing, pricing, and promotions with scientific precision. Over $360B is spent annually on paid advertising in the US alone, and the famous quote “half the money I spend on advertising is wasted; the trouble is I don't know which half” still rings true. Haus helps marketers identify which half, and reallocate it to maximize growth.

With a founding team of former product managers, economists, and engineers from Google, Netflix, Meta, and Amazon, we make high-quality decision science,incrementality testing, and causal marketing mix modeling accessible to businesses of all sizes—automating the heavy lifting of experiment design, data processing, and insights generation. Haus works with leading brands like FanDuel, Sonos, and Dr. Squatch, delivering ROI gains as high as 30x.

Haus is well-capitalized and backed by top-tier VCs, including Insight Partners, Baseline Ventures, Haystack, and others. We're honored that Haus has once again been recognized by LinkedIn as a 2025 Top Startup!


What You’ll Do

As an early member of the Revenue team at Haus, you’ll have the opportunity to shape the direction and scope of the Solutions Consultant role from the ground up. You’ll be responsible for building trust and confidence with prospective customers and supporting the organization’s growth alongside a hard-working team of Account Executives.

About You

  • Passionate about the intersection of growth marketing and science

  • Strong communication skills and the ability to distill complex concepts into digestible terms

  • Intrinsic and contagious curiosity that drives you to understand products in all of their technical depth

  • Team-player that’s willing to roll up your sleeves and help the team achieve its goals, even if it means doing something beyond your usual responsibilities

  • Ability to anticipate and empathize with a customer’s needs in order to present solutions in an appealing manner

  • Ability to navigate an ambiguous environment, switching between quick day-to-day client tasks and longer-term organization projects

Roles and responsibilities

  • Providing technical demonstrations of the Haus product to prospective customers

  • Answering technical questions about the product and serving as a subject matter expert

  • Creating tailored presentations and navigating competitive pitches

  • Building testing roadmaps that will deliver value to customers during their initial time on the platform

  • Conducting feasibility analyses to ensure we’ll be able to deliver value for prospective customers

  • Delivering feedback to the product team and representing our prospective customers’ needs in internal discussions

  • Attending conferences and events in order to generate pipeline

  • Staying current with industry trends and best practices in marketing measurement to continuously improve processes and outcomes

Qualifications

  • 5+ years of experience in growth marketing, marketing analytics, or related fields.

  • Experience in a customer facing role; experience in a new-business-oriented role is a plus.

  • Strong written communication and experience presenting to customers and executives.

  • Proven ability to work well within a team environment

Travel Requirements

Must be willing to travel 10-25% of the time to engage with clients and support global marketing initiatives.

What We Offer

We’re a customer-obsessed, high-ownership team focused on driving impact and learning fast. Our environment rewards curiosity, adaptability, and a bias toward action — especially when it helps us better serve our customers.

If you're energized by solving dynamic problems, enjoy working in lean, collaborative teams, and thrive in ever-evolving environments, you’ll feel at home here. We invest in exceptional people who want to grow quickly and help shape the future of the company.

Some of our benefits include:

  • Flexible PTO - take time when you need it!

  • Equity – Startup environment with part-ownership in our successes

  • Top of the line health, dental, and vision insurance - multiple plan options so you can pick what fits you best

  • WFH stipend to support the set up you need to be productive

  • Events & Offsites – opportunities to connect and celebrate in real life!

  • Free Lunch – Grab a bite on us when you choose to work from the office (hub locations include SF, NYC and Seattle)

  • New Parent Leave – take time to welcome your newest Hausmate

Haus is an equal opportunity employer. We make hiring decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other protected status.

We believe diverse perspectives make us stronger and are committed to an inclusive culture where everyone feels seen, heard, and empowered to contribute. Bring your authentic self — we would love to hear from you.

jobs.title: Account Executive - Enterprise
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Haus

Haus is the incrementality platform leading brands trust to optimize billions in ad spend worldwide. Using frontier causal inference-based econometric models to run experiments, we help brands measure the business impact of marketing, pricing, and promotions with scientific precision. Over $360B is spent annually on paid advertising in the US alone, and the famous quote “half the money I spend on advertising is wasted; the trouble is I don't know which half” still rings true. Haus helps marketers identify which half, and reallocate it to maximize growth.

With a founding team of former product managers, economists, and engineers from Google, Netflix, Meta, and Amazon, we make high-quality decision science,incrementality testing, and causal marketing mix modeling accessible to businesses of all sizes—automating the heavy lifting of experiment design, data processing, and insights generation. Haus works with leading brands like FanDuel, Sonos, and Dr. Squatch, delivering ROI gains as high as 30x.

Haus is well-capitalized and backed by top-tier VCs, including Insight Partners, Baseline Ventures, Haystack, and others. We're honored that Haus has once again been recognized by LinkedIn as a 2025 Top Startup!

What you'll do

As an Enterprise Account Executive, you will be responsible for navigating complex sales cycles within a designated list of Fortune 500 accounts. This role is not simply about closing deals but about orchestrating resources, building consensus, and developing deep, strategic relationships with key stakeholders. You will be expected to thrive in a high-autonomy environment, leveraging your business acumen to uncover critical needs and position Haus as a mission-critical partner.


Role & Responsibilities:

  • Strategic Account Ownership: Own the full sales cycle from prospecting to close and expansion for a select list of Fortune 500 enterprise accounts.

  • Territory and Account Planning: Develop and execute comprehensive territory and account plans, identifying key decision-makers and aligning Haus's value proposition with their strategic business initiatives.

  • Consultative Sales Leadership: Lead complex, multi-threaded sales cycles that involve multiple stakeholders across marketing, data science, finance, and engineering.

  • Drive Successful Adoption and Strategic Expansion: Work proactively with the Customer Success team to ensure deep product adoption and identify opportunities for account expansion and cross-sell.

  • Elevate Haus’s Visibility: Increase Haus’s visibility and communicate our value proposition effectively to Vice Presidents and C-Suite executives within these accounts.

  • Collaboration with Solutions Engineers: Work closely with your solutions engineer counterpart to deliver both business and technical value to prospects and customers.

  • Cross-functional Collaboration: Collaborate with internal teams, including product, data science, marketing, and engineering to align our offerings with customer business needs effectively.

Qualifications

  • 5+ years of experience in a closing sales role, specifically selling SaaS or data analytics solutions to Fortune 500 companies.

  • Proven track record of consistently meeting or exceeding quota expectations in an enterprise sales environment.

  • Expertise in navigating consultative, multi-stakeholder sales cycles with executive-level stakeholders.

  • Demonstrated ability to manage complex deal negotiations and build strong relationships across large organizations.

  • Demonstrated ability to cross-sell within your book of business. Familiarity with and experience using the MEDDPICC sales methodology is advantageous.

  • Travel: Expected range of 25% to 50% to build relationships with clients and attend industry events.

About You

  • Strategic & Outcome-Oriented: You think like a business leader, not just a salesperson, and are focused on driving tangible outcomes for your clients.

  • Executive Presence: You are comfortable and confident engaging with senior-level executives and can articulate complex concepts clearly and concisely.

  • Competitive: You love to win. You are comfortable aggressively selling your solution in a growing market. You are willing to stretch your resources, knowledge, and comfort zone to get the win.

  • Highly Collaborative: You excel at orchestrating internal and external teams to drive a deal forward.

  • Entrepreneurial and Self-Motivated: You are driven and proactive, taking ownership of your role and responsibilities.

  • Comfort with Ambiguity: You strive in environments with high ambiguity and require creative problem solving.

  • Intellectual Curiosity and Ambition: You have a hunger for knowledge and strive for ambitious goals.

  • Adaptability: You excel in a fast-paced and dynamic startup environment that is constantly evolving.

What We Offer:
We’re a customer-obsessed, high-ownership team focused on driving impact and learning fast. Our environment rewards curiosity, adaptability, and a bias toward action — especially when it helps us better serve our customers.

If you're energized by solving dynamic problems, enjoy working in lean, collaborative teams, and thrive in ever-evolving environments, you’ll feel at home here. We invest in exceptional people who want to grow quickly and help shape the future of the company.

Some of our benefits include:

  • Flexible PTO - take time when you need it!

  • Equity – Startup environment with part-ownership in our successes

  • Top of the line health, dental, and vision insurance - multiple plan options so you can pick what fits you best

  • WFH stipend to support the set up you need to be productive

  • Events & Offsites – opportunities to connect and celebrate in real life!

  • Free Lunch – Grab a bite on us when you choose to work from the office (hub locations include SF, NYC and Seattle)

  • New Parent Leave – take time to welcome your newest Hausmate

Haus is an equal opportunity employer. We make hiring decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other protected status.

We believe diverse perspectives make us stronger and are committed to an inclusive culture where everyone feels seen, heard, and empowered to contribute. Bring your authentic self — we would love to hear from you.

jobs.title: Account Executive
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Haus

Haus is the incrementality platform leading brands trust to optimize billions in ad spend worldwide. Using frontier causal inference-based econometric models to run experiments, we help brands measure the business impact of marketing, pricing, and promotions with scientific precision. Over $360B is spent annually on paid advertising in the US alone, and the famous quote “half the money I spend on advertising is wasted; the trouble is I don't know which half” still rings true. Haus helps marketers identify which half, and reallocate it to maximize growth.

With a founding team of former product managers, economists, and engineers from Google, Netflix, Meta, and Amazon, we make high-quality decision science,incrementality testing, and causal marketing mix modeling accessible to businesses of all sizes—automating the heavy lifting of experiment design, data processing, and insights generation. Haus works with leading brands like FanDuel, Sonos, and Dr. Squatch, delivering ROI gains as high as 30x.

Haus is well-capitalized and backed by top-tier VCs, including Insight Partners, Baseline Ventures, Haystack, and others. We're honored that Haus has once again been recognized by LinkedIn as a 2025 Top Startup!

What you'll do
As an Account Executive, you will play a pivotal role in generating, nurturing and expanding relationships with accounts within your designated account list. You should possess exceptional business acumen, a customer-centric approach, and the self-motivation to thrive with minimal supervision. Moreover, you must be adaptable and proficient in wearing multiple hats as you take on this crucial responsibility. We have full confidence in your ability to make the right decisions and drive results autonomously.

Roles & Responsibilities:

  • Ownership of Accounts: You will be the primary point of contact and relationship owner for accounts within your territory.

  • Territory and Account Planning: Develop comprehensive territory and account plans, and proactively drive outbound pipeline generation independently.

  • Ensure Successful Adoption: Work with the CS team to ensure the adoption of Haus within these accounts through account management. Coordinate closely with sales engineering & customer success, to guarantee client satisfaction.

  • Elevate Haus’s Visibility: Increase Haus’s visibility and communicate our value proposition effectively to Vice Presidents and C-Suite executives within these accounts.

  • Collaboration with Solutions Engineers: Work closely with your solutions engineer counterpart to deliver both business and technical value to prospects and customers.

  • Cross-functional Collaboration: Collaborate with internal teams, including product, data science, marketing, and engineering to align our offerings with customer business needs effectively.

Qualifications

  • 5+ Years of (closing) Sales Experience.

  • You have a demonstrable track record of consistently meeting or exceeding quota expectations.

  • You possess the expertise to navigate consultative sales cycles with Executive-level stakeholders at Fortune 500 companies.

  • You are comfortable working within a startup environment that is constantly evolving. 

  • Demonstrated ability to be able to cross-sell within your book of business. Familiarity with and experience using the MEDDPICC sales methodology is advantageous.

  • Travel: expected range of 25% to 50% as needed.

About You

  • Entrepreneurial and Self-Motivated: You are driven and proactive, taking ownership of your role and responsibilities.

  • Passion for Learning and Growth: You are enthusiastic about continuous learning and personal development at Haus.

  • Intellectual Curiosity and Ambition: You have a hunger for knowledge and strive for ambitious goals.

  • Excellent Communication: Your written and spoken communication skills are outstanding.

  • Highly Organized & Autonomous: You are capable of efficiently managing your workload and thrive in an environment that encourages autonomy.

  • Adaptability: You excel in a fast-paced and dynamic organizational setting.

What We Offer

We’re a high-performance, low-ego team operating in a fast-moving environment. We care deeply about our customers and expect everyone to take full ownership of their work — this is a place where high expectations fuel even higher growth.

If you thrive in ambiguity, take pride in raising the bar, and want to work alongside top-tier peers who challenge and support you, you'll find unmatched opportunities here. If you're looking for predictability or rigid structure or you prefer order-taking to go-getting, we’re probably not the right fit — and that’s okay.

We work in small, mission-driven teams that prioritize inclusion, collaboration, and growth over hierarchy or red tape.

Some of our benefits include:

  • Flexible PTO - take time when you need it!

  • Equity – Startup environment with part-ownership in our successes

  • Top of the line health, dental, and vision insurance - multiple plan options so you can pick what fits you best

  • WFH stipend to support the set up you need to be productive

  • Events & Offsites – opportunities to connect and celebrate in real life!

  • Free Lunch – Grab a bite on us when you choose to work from the office (hub locations include SF, NYC and Seattle)

  • New Parent Leave – take time to welcome your newest Hausmate

Haus is an equal opportunity employer. We make hiring decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other protected status.

We believe diverse perspectives make us stronger and are committed to an inclusive culture where everyone feels seen, heard, and empowered to contribute. Bring your authentic self — we would love to hear from you.

jobs.title: [Senior / Staff] Software Engineer, Data Platform
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Haus

Haus is the incrementality platform leading brands trust to optimize billions in ad spend worldwide. Using frontier causal inference-based econometric models to run experiments, we help brands measure the business impact of marketing, pricing, and promotions with scientific precision. Over $360B is spent annually on paid advertising in the US alone, and the famous quote “half the money I spend on advertising is wasted; the trouble is I don't know which half” still rings true. With a founding team of former product managers, economists, and engineers from Google, Netflix, Meta, and Amazon, we make high-quality decision science,incrementality testing, and causal marketing mix modeling accessible to businesses of all sizes—automating the heavy lifting of experiment design, data processing, and insights generation. Haus works with leading brands like FanDuel, Sonos, and Dr. Squatch, delivering ROI gains as high as 30x.

Haus is well-capitalized and backed by top-tier VCs, including Insight Partners, Baseline Ventures, Haystack, and others. We're honored that Haus has once again been recognized by LinkedIn as a 2025 Top Startup!

What you'll do:
This is a unique opportunity to help us build robust and scalable systems that handle data  workloads at Haus.  The Data Platform includes systems that power the Haus product and are at the heart of what we do.
The ideal candidate is somebody who loves working with data, is a great software engineer, and an excellent communicator.  You will design, scale, and maintain the systems that support the Haus platform and enable data-driven decision-making at Haus.

Responsibilities

  • Build data solutions on top of Google Cloud Platform using Python and other languages as appropriate.

  • Contribute to the technical direction and development of Haus’ data infrastructure, tools, and applications.

  • Create and maintain data pipelines and foundational datasets to support analytics, modeling, experimentation, and product/business needs.

  • Work closely with science, machine learning, and engineering teams to support the development of new data pipelines.

  • Develop and support data quality checks at scale, implementing alerting and anomaly detection as necessary

  • Create scalable dashboards and reports to support business objectives and enable data-driven decision making

  • Partner with data scientists, engineers, and product teams to accomplish all of the above!

Qualifications

  • 4-7+ years of experience as a Software Engineer.

  • Experience building and deploying products that rely on large-scale distributed systems in Python or Go, Scala/Java, or other similar languages:  it makes you uncomfortable deploying something for end-users without thinking about things like performance metrics, monitors and dashboards, graceful degradation and feature flags.

  • Third party integrations - API are your bread and butter.

  • Experience with cloud infrastructure (Google Cloud, AWS, etc).

  • Experience working with SQL databases.

Bonus points

  • Earlier stage startup experience.

  • Experience with build systems and infrastructure management tooling like Terraform. 

  • Experience with data warehouses: Snowflake, BigQuery, RedShift.

  • BS/MS/PhD in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics or a related field.

What we offer

We’re a high-performance, low-ego team operating in a fast-moving environment. We care deeply about our customers and expect everyone to take full ownership of their work — this is a place where high expectations fuel even higher growth.

If you thrive in ambiguity, take pride in raising the bar, and want to work alongside top-tier peers who challenge and support you, you'll find unmatched opportunities here. If you're looking for predictability or rigid structure or you prefer order-taking to go-getting, we’re probably not the right fit — and that’s okay.

We work in small, mission-driven teams that prioritize inclusion, collaboration, and growth over hierarchy or red tape.

Some of our benefits include:

  • Flexible PTO - take time when you need it!

  • Equity – Startup environment with part-ownership in our successes

  • Top of the line health, dental, and vision insurance - multiple plan options so you can pick what fits you best

  • WFH stipend to support the set up you need to be productive

  • Events & Offsites – opportunities to connect and celebrate in real life!

  • Free Lunch – Grab a bite on us when you choose to work from the office (hub locations include SF, NYC and Seattle)

  • New Parent Leave – take time to welcome your newest Hausmate

Haus is an equal opportunity employer. We make hiring decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other protected status.

We believe diverse perspectives make us stronger and are committed to an inclusive culture where everyone feels seen, heard, and empowered to contribute. Bring your authentic self — we would love to hear from you.

jobs.title: Measurement Strategy Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Haus

Haus is the incrementality platform leading brands trust to optimize billions in ad spend worldwide. Using frontier causal inference-based econometric models to run experiments, we help brands measure the business impact of marketing, pricing, and promotions with scientific precision. Over $360B is spent annually on paid advertising in the US alone, and the famous quote “half the money I spend on advertising is wasted; the trouble is I don't know which half” still rings true. Haus helps marketers identify which half, and reallocate it to maximize growth.

With a founding team of former product managers, economists, and engineers from Google, Netflix, Meta, and Amazon, we make high-quality decision science,incrementality testing, and causal marketing mix modeling accessible to businesses of all sizes—automating the heavy lifting of experiment design, data processing, and insights generation. Haus works with leading brands like FanDuel, Sonos, and Dr. Squatch, delivering ROI gains as high as 30x.

Haus is well-capitalized and backed by top-tier VCs, including Insight Partners, Baseline Ventures, Haystack, and others. We're honored that Haus has once again been recognized by LinkedIn as a 2025 Top Startup!

What you'll do:
As a Measurement Strategy Manager at Haus, you will work hand-in-hand with a portfolio of customers to define and act on their measurement roadmap. You will deeply understand the goals of your customers' businesses, propose testing strategies that align to their goals, and drive your customers to act on the things they learn through Haus. You will serve as an evangelist for incrementality measurement and help your customers make critical business decisions based on Haus reporting. 
As a member of a small and rapidly growing team, you will also be expected to contribute in ways that benefit the entire organization. Each member of our team brings a form of expertise that serves to elevate the capabilities of the entire team; we expect everyone to be a bar raiser in some way.

Roles & responsibilities will include:

  • Co-design experimentation roadmaps with customers, considering their media plan and operating goals to plan the best use of their testing slots and driving them toward a continuous experimentation program

  • Shepherd customers through the entire experimentation process, from design, to implementation, interpretation, and action steps

  • Advise customers on best practices in order to maximize value and ROI from the platform; empower our customers to connect their business questions with Haus product offerings

  • Serve as a trusted partner to our customers on interpretation of test results and how to take action, simplifying complex concepts into easy-to-understand recommendations

  • Identify risks or escalations and manage those with a complete ownership mentality while bringing in necessary internal resources 

  • Contribute to the team with the creation of collateral, resources, playbooks, and workflows that balance quality of service with designing for scale

  • Partner closely with our Product, Science, & Engineering teams to translate customer requests into scalable product features

  • Own customer renewals

  • Identify qualified cross-sell opportunities

Qualifications

  • You have deep empathy for growth marketers’ measurement needs, either because you have been in a growth marketing role or because you’ve been a close vendor/partner to growth marketers (agency, platform); we are looking for 4+ years of experience as a growth marketer or in a marketing science role

  • You have a fluent understanding of paid media buying

  • You might describe yourself as a ‘measurement nerd’. You light up when you talk about experimentation and you get tons of energy from data analysis and storytelling 

  • You have experience in a customer relationship management role and have the ability to interact and collaborate with key stakeholders within customer organizations

  • You are a wizard of productivity. Coworkers are in awe of your ability to produce very high quality work at a rapid pace and while context-switching across tasks

  • You have a demonstrated track record in an early-stage company or highly ambiguous environment where you need to juggle multiple projects at once

  • You are scrappy and resourceful; you unpromptedly fill any gaps necessary to keep your customers happy

  • You have strong written communication and experience presenting to customers and executives

What we offer

We’re a customer-obsessed, high-ownership team focused on driving impact and learning fast. Our environment rewards curiosity, adaptability, and a bias toward action — especially when it helps us better serve our customers.

If you're energized by solving dynamic problems, enjoy working in lean, collaborative teams, and thrive in ever-evolving environments, you’ll feel at home here. We invest in exceptional people who want to grow quickly and help shape the future of the company.

Some of our benefits include:

  • Flexible PTO - take time when you need it!

  • Equity – Startup environment with part-ownership in our successes

  • Top of the line health, dental, and vision insurance - multiple plan options so you can pick what fits you best

  • WFH stipend to support the set up you need to be productive

  • Events & Offsites – opportunities to connect and celebrate in real life!

  • Free Lunch – Grab a bite on us when you choose to work from the office (hub locations include SF, NYC and Seattle)

  • New Parent Leave – take time to welcome your newest Hausmate

Haus is an equal opportunity employer. We make hiring decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other protected status.

We believe diverse perspectives make us stronger and are committed to an inclusive culture where everyone feels seen, heard, and empowered to contribute. Bring your authentic self — we would love to hear from you.

jobs.title: Analytical Lead - Causal Inference
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Haus

Haus is the incrementality platform leading brands trust to optimize billions in ad spend worldwide. Using frontier causal inference-based econometric models to run experiments, we help brands measure the business impact of marketing, pricing, and promotions with scientific precision. Over $360B is spent annually on paid advertising in the US alone, and the famous quote “half the money I spend on advertising is wasted; the trouble is I don't know which half” still rings true. Haus is well-capitalized and backed by top-tier VCs, including Insight Partners, Baseline Ventures, Haystack, and others. We're honored that Haus has once again been recognized by LinkedIn as a 2025 Top Startup!

What you'll do

You will partner directly with the Measurement Strategy team to support the delivery and interpretation of results from our cutting-edge science platform to meet fast growing customer demands. You will serve as a trusted advisor to our customers, focusing on driving value and confidence in results. Collaborating across Measurement Strategy, Science, Engineering, and Product teams, you will develop solutions to ensure robust, reliable results and seamless communication at scale.

The ideal candidate is excited to dive deep into the data and communicate actionable insights to diverse audiences. You will be instrumental in delivering solutions that drive customer value and increase results robustness, process efficiency, and technical clarity. You thrive in dynamic environments, enjoy collaborating with cross-functional stakeholders, and are passionate about continually improving processes and helping customers unlock the full value of our platform.

Please apply if you want to provide real value, learn new things, and own the delivery of critical insights on a growing data science product.

Responsibilities

  • Partner closely with our Measurement Strategy, Science, and Product leads to deliver analyses on gaps and pain points in our modeling and results delivery process.

  • Develop and implement solutions to up-level existing workflows, visualizations, and metrics to bring high-quality insights at scale to all of our customers.

  • Serve as a trusted advisor to our customers on interpretation of test results and scientific methodology, distilling complex statistical / econometrics concepts into actionable recommendations.

Qualifications

  • 5+ years working in a Data Scientist / Analyst role, or a data-intensive consulting role with a focus on delivery, process, or execution.

  • MSc/PhD in Economics, Statistics, or another quantitative field, or equivalent industry/academic experience.

  • Strong communication skills with experience synthesizing complex technical concepts concisely and precisely to customers and/or cross-functional stakeholders.

  • Experience researching, developing and implementing causal inference methodologies

  • Proficiency with analytical tools such as Looker, Tableau, dbt.

  • Proficiency in languages such as Python and SQL.

  • Familiarity with marketing measurement methodologies, particularly geo-based or regional testing, is a plus.

About you

  • Done is better than perfect - you take small exploratory steps rather than large precise leaps toward solutions. 

  • Act like an owner - you take shared responsibility for team success. You bring attention-to-detail and rigor to model and data deep dives.

  • Be curious - you’re eager to test new ideas and solve novel problems.

What we offer

jobs.descriptionPlain:
About Haus

Haus is the incrementality platform leading brands trust to optimize billions in ad spend worldwide. Using frontier causal inference-based econometric models to run experiments, we help brands measure the business impact of marketing, pricing, and promotions with scientific precision. Over $360B is spent annually on paid advertising in the US alone, and the famous quote “half the money I spend on advertising is wasted; the trouble is I don't know which half” still rings true. Haus helps marketers identify which half, and reallocate it to maximize growth.


With a founding team of former product managers, economists, and engineers from Google, Netflix, Meta, and Amazon, we make high-quality decision science,incrementality testing, and causal marketing mix modeling accessible to businesses of all sizes—automating the heavy lifting of experiment design, data processing, and insights generation. Haus works with leading brands like FanDuel, Sonos, and Dr. Squatch, delivering ROI gains as high as 30x.

Haus is well-capitalized and backed by top-tier VCs, including Insight Partners, Baseline Ventures, Haystack, and others. We're honored that Haus has once again been recognized by LinkedIn as a 2025 Top Startup https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/linkedin-top-startups-2025-50-us-companies-rise-linkedin-news-hox6f/!

What you'll do

You will partner directly with the Measurement Strategy team to support the delivery and interpretation of results from our cutting-edge science platform to meet fast growing customer demands. You will serve as a trusted advisor to our customers, focusing on driving value and confidence in results. Collaborating across Measurement Strategy, Science, Engineering, and Product teams, you will develop solutions to ensure robust, reliable results and seamless communication at scale.

The ideal candidate is excited to dive deep into the data and communicate actionable insights to diverse audiences. You will be instrumental in delivering solutions that drive customer value and increase results robustness, process efficiency, and technical clarity. You thrive in dynamic environments, enjoy collaborating with cross-functional stakeholders, and are passionate about continually improving processes and helping customers unlock the full value of our platform.

Please apply if you want to provide real value, learn new things, and own the delivery of critical insights on a growing data science product.

Responsibilities

 - Partner closely with our Measurement Strategy, Science, and Product leads to deliver analyses on gaps and pain points in our modeling and results delivery process.

 - Develop and implement solutions to up-level existing workflows, visualizations, and metrics to bring high-quality insights at scale to all of our customers.

 - Serve as a trusted advisor to our customers on interpretation of test results and scientific methodology, distilling complex statistical / econometrics concepts into actionable recommendations.

Qualifications

 - 5+ years working in a Data Scientist / Analyst role, or a data-intensive consulting role with a focus on delivery, process, or execution.

 - MSc/PhD in Economics, Statistics, or another quantitative field, or equivalent industry/academic experience.

 - Strong communication skills with experience synthesizing complex technical concepts concisely and precisely to customers and/or cross-functional stakeholders.

 - Experience researching, developing and implementing causal inference methodologies

 - Proficiency with analytical tools such as Looker, Tableau, dbt.

 - Proficiency in languages such as Python and SQL.

 - Familiarity with marketing measurement methodologies, particularly geo-based or regional testing, is a plus.

About you

 - Done is better than perfect - you take small exploratory steps rather than large precise leaps toward solutions. 

 - Act like an owner - you take shared responsibility for team success. You bring attention-to-detail and rigor to model and data deep dives.

 - Be curious - you’re eager to test new ideas and solve novel problems.

What we offer

We’re a high-performance, low-ego team operating in a fast-moving environment. We care deeply about our customers and expect everyone to take full ownership of their work — this is a place where high expectations fuel even higher growth.

If you thrive in ambiguity, take pride in raising the bar, and want to work alongside top-tier peers who challenge and support you, you'll find unmatched opportunities here. If you're looking for predictability or rigid structure or you prefer order-taking to go-getting, we’re probably not the right fit — and that’s okay.

We work in small, mission-driven teams that prioritize inclusion, collaboration, and growth over hierarchy or red tape.

Some of our benefits include:

 - Flexible PTO - take time when you need it!

 - Equity – Startup environment with part-ownership in our successes

 - Top of the line health, dental, and vision insurance - multiple plan options so you can pick what fits you best

 - WFH stipend to support the set up you need to be productive

 - Events & Offsites – opportunities to connect and celebrate in real life!

 - Free Lunch – Grab a bite on us when you choose to work from the office (hub locations include SF, NYC and Seattle)

 - New Parent Leave – take time to welcome your newest Hausmate
   

Haus is an equal opportunity employer. We make hiring decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other protected status.


We believe diverse perspectives make us stronger and are committed to an inclusive culture where everyone feels seen, heard, and empowered to contribute. Bring your authentic self — we would love to hear from you.

jobs.title: Senior PM, Data Products
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Haus

Haus is the incrementality platform leading brands trust to optimize billions in ad spend worldwide. Using frontier causal inference-based econometric models to run experiments, we help brands measure the business impact of marketing, pricing, and promotions with scientific precision. Over $360B is spent annually on paid advertising in the US alone, and the famous quote “half the money I spend on advertising is wasted; the trouble is I don't know which half” still rings true. With a founding team of former product managers, economists, and engineers from Google, Netflix, Meta, and Amazon, we make high-quality decision science,incrementality testing, and causal marketing mix modeling accessible to businesses of all sizes—automating the heavy lifting of experiment design, data processing, and insights generation. Haus works with leading brands like FanDuel, Sonos, and Dr. Squatch, delivering ROI gains as high as 30x.

Haus is well-capitalized and backed by top-tier VCs, including Insight Partners, Baseline Ventures, Haystack, and others. We're honored that Haus has once again been recognized by LinkedIn as a 2025 Top Startup!

About this role

Data is the lifeblood of Haus and powers every application. This Data Product Manager will successfully devise and execute a data strategy for Haus. In the role, this PM will answer questions like:

  • How can we onboard customer data faster, and with less friction, to Haus?

  • How might we forge partnerships with retailers and other major data providers to accelerate what data customers can utilize out-of-the-box?

  • How can we scale our data pipeline as our business grows?

  • How can we present compelling data insights to our customers that will become critical parts of their workflows?

Responsibilities:

  • Work with engineering, sales, design, and customer success to develop a data product roadmap

  • Perform customer discovery to uncover customer needs

  • Develop systems for tracking performance and measuring success

  • Develop a data partnerships strategy & forge alliances with data providers

  • Define processes to improve the operational efficiency of our internal teams

Requirements:

  • 6+ years of experience as a product manager working on a data-heavy application, or equivalent similar experience

  • Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative discipline such as computer science, economics, engineering, or statistics.

  • Strong familiarity with data warehouse technologies and APIs

Nice to have:

  • Experience building data onboarding/ingestion tools or developing a data platform

  • Experience working with marketing and advertising data

What we offer

We’re a customer-obsessed, high-ownership team focused on driving impact and learning fast. Our environment rewards curiosity, adaptability, and a bias toward action — especially when it helps us better serve our customers.

If you're energized by solving dynamic problems, enjoy working in lean, collaborative teams, and thrive in ever-evolving environments, you’ll feel at home here. We invest in exceptional people who want to grow quickly and help shape the future of the company.

Some of our benefits include:

  • Flexible PTO - take time when you need it!

  • Equity – Startup environment with part-ownership in our successes

  • Top of the line health, dental, and vision insurance - multiple plan options so you can pick what fits you best

  • WFH stipend to support the set up you need to be productive

  • Events & Offsites – opportunities to connect and celebrate in real life!

  • Free Lunch – Grab a bite on us when you choose to work from the office (hub locations include SF, NYC and Seattle)

  • New Parent Leave – take time to welcome your newest Hausmate

Haus is an equal opportunity employer. We make hiring decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other protected status.

We believe diverse perspectives make us stronger and are committed to an inclusive culture where everyone feels seen, heard, and empowered to contribute. Bring your authentic self — we would love to hear from you.

jobs.title: Head of Data & Analytics
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Haus

Haus is the incrementality platform leading brands trust to optimize billions in ad spend worldwide. Using frontier causal inference-based econometric models to run experiments, we help brands measure the business impact of marketing, pricing, and promotions with scientific precision. Over $360B is spent annually on paid advertising in the US alone, and the famous quote “half the money I spend on advertising is wasted; the trouble is I don't know which half” still rings true. Haus helps marketers identify which half, and reallocate it to maximize growth.

With a founding team of former product managers, economists, and engineers from Google, Netflix, Meta, and Amazon, we make high-quality decision science,incrementality testing, and causal marketing mix modeling accessible to businesses of all sizes—automating the heavy lifting of experiment design, data processing, and insights generation. Haus works with leading brands like FanDuel, Sonos, and Dr. Squatch, delivering ROI gains as high as 30x.

Haus is well-capitalized and backed by top-tier VCs, including Insight Partners, Baseline Ventures, Haystack, and others. We're honored that Haus has once again been recognized by LinkedIn as a 2025 Top Startup!

What you'll do

Own Haus’s internal analytics efforts from go to market success, product usage and KPIs, and analytics engineering. You’ll get your hands dirty but also build and lead a small team whose scope will span the following:

  • GTM Analytics: Partner with Marketing, Sales, and Customer to deliver pipeline, conversion, and ROI analytics; build forecasting for new business and retention, attribution, CAC/payback reporting.

  • Product Analytics: Drive analysis of feature adoption, engagement, and retention indicators; enable experimentation and A/B testing frameworks. Paint a picture of our customers’ health in general and across key areas of the product.

  • Analytics Engineering: Own data warehouse and metric layer using Fivetran for pipelines, dbt for transformations, BI tooling (Looker, Mode, Hex, Tableau).


Responsibilities:

  • Define Haus’s analytics strategy and roadmap across GTM and product.

  • Build scalable pipelines and metric layers with high data integrity

  • Deliver exec-ready insights on ARR, retention, funnel velocity, product adoption, and more

  • Refine and implement an AI tooling strategy that allows us to take advantage of new technology to execute with speed and accuracy

  • Partner with cross-functional leaders to embed data into daily decisions

  • Promote data literacy and self-serve analytics culture

  • Recruit and develop a lean, high-impact team

Qualifications

  • 8+ years in analytics/data roles; 3+ years in leadership.

  • Hands-on expertise in SQL, dbt, data modeling, warehouse architecture.

  • Proven experience with Fivetran (or similar ETL/ELT).

  • Proficiency in modern BI tools.

  • B2B SaaS or enterprise AI background.

  • Experience with AI/ML in GTM and product analytics.

  • Excellent communicator; startup mindset.

What We Offer

We’re a customer-obsessed, high-ownership team focused on driving impact and learning fast. Our environment rewards curiosity, adaptability, and a bias toward action — especially when it helps us better serve our customers.

If you're energized by solving dynamic problems, enjoy working in lean, collaborative teams, and thrive in ever-evolving environments, you’ll feel at home here. We invest in exceptional people who want to grow quickly and help shape the future of the company.

Some of our benefits include:

  • Flexible PTO - take time when you need it!

  • Equity – Startup environment with part-ownership in our successes

  • Top of the line health, dental, and vision insurance - multiple plan options so you can pick what fits you best

  • WFH stipend to support the set up you need to be productive

  • Events & Offsites – opportunities to connect and celebrate in real life!

  • Free Lunch – Grab a bite on us when you choose to work from the office (hub locations include SF, NYC and Seattle)

  • New Parent Leave – take time to welcome your newest Hausmate

Haus is an equal opportunity employer. We make hiring decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other protected status.

We believe diverse perspectives make us stronger and are committed to an inclusive culture where everyone feels seen, heard, and empowered to contribute. Bring your authentic self — we would love to hear from you.

jobs.title: Senior Applied Scientist, New Products
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Haus

Haus is the incrementality platform leading brands trust to optimize billions in ad spend worldwide. Using frontier causal inference-based econometric models to run experiments, we help brands measure the business impact of marketing, pricing, and promotions with scientific precision. Over $360B is spent annually on paid advertising in the US alone, and the famous quote “half the money I spend on advertising is wasted; the trouble is I don't know which half” still rings true. Haus helps marketers identify which half, and reallocate it to maximize growth.

With a founding team of former product managers, economists, and engineers from Google, Netflix, Meta, and Amazon, we make high-quality decision science,incrementality testing, and causal marketing mix modeling accessible to businesses of all sizes—automating the heavy lifting of experiment design, data processing, and insights generation. Haus works with leading brands like FanDuel, Sonos, and Dr. Squatch, delivering ROI gains as high as 30x.

Haus is well-capitalized and backed by top-tier VCs, including Insight Partners, Baseline Ventures, Haystack, and others. We're honored that Haus has once again been recognized by LinkedIn as a 2025 Top Startup!

What You'll Do

You will collaborate closely with cross-functional stakeholders to understand customer problems and develop novel solutions, specifically focusing on building solutions for causal inference use cases. You will work alongside with other scientists and engineers to develop these solutions into products on our platform that will benefit our growing customer base.

The ideal candidate is a hands-on applied scientist who is excited to implement and deploy new causal inference models via scalable software solutions that drive value for customers. You thrive on execution and are able to use strong judgment and clear, succinct communication to drive the right decisions for delivering on our ambitious roadmap. You will be expected to bring a strong point of view on model productionization and scaling, guiding the team in building robust and efficient systems.

Responsibilities

  • Drive the implementation of innovative solutions that empower our customers to answer important business questions and drive decision-making.

  • Own building solutions, models, and products while working cross-functionally with scientists and engineers to ingest customer data and deploy models and tools that deliver meaningful results on a regular cadence.

  • Champion best practices like tests, validations, monitoring, and alerting to ensure high quality experiences for a growing number of customers.

  • Partner closely with Haus science and product leads to develop scalable solutions to customer problems, enabling these solutions to become core products in Haus’ product suite.

Qualifications

  • MSc/PhD in a quantitative field such as Economics, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, or equivalent industry/academic experience.

  • 5+ years working in an Applied Scientist/Machine Learning Engineer role building science models and products for production environments.

  • Experience coding (Python/SQL) and troubleshooting models built for deployment.

  • Experience in statistics and machine learning.

  • Proven ability to tackle technically ambiguous problems and collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders.

Must haves

  • Enthusiasm for learning or applying causal inference and econometrics, and for scaling causal inference models.

  • Strong communication skills with the ability to synthesize complex technical concepts concisely and precisely.

About you

  • Done is better than perfect - you take small exploratory steps rather than large precise leaps toward solutions. You’re a critical thinker who enjoys pragmatically balancing technical depth vs. progressing quickly.

  • Act like an owner - you take shared responsibility for team success. You bring attention-to-detail and rigor to model development and data deep dives.

  • Be curious - you’re eager to test new ideas and solve novel problems.

What we offer

We’re a customer-obsessed, high-ownership team focused on driving impact and learning fast. Our environment rewards curiosity, adaptability, and a bias toward action — especially when it helps us better serve our customers.

If you're energized by solving dynamic problems, enjoy working in lean, collaborative teams, and thrive in ever-evolving environments, you’ll feel at home here. We invest in exceptional people who want to grow quickly and help shape the future of the company.

Some of our benefits include:

  • Flexible PTO - take time when you need it!

  • Equity – Startup environment with part-ownership in our successes

  • Top of the line health, dental, and vision insurance - multiple plan options so you can pick what fits you best

  • WFH stipend to support the set up you need to be productive

  • Events & Offsites – opportunities to connect and celebrate in real life!

  • Free Lunch – Grab a bite on us when you choose to work from the office (hub locations include SF, NYC and Seattle)

  • New Parent Leave – take time to welcome your newest Hausmate

We believe diverse perspectives make us stronger and are committed to an inclusive culture where everyone feels seen, heard, and empowered to contribute. Bring your authentic self — we would love to hear from you.
